ID: When the medical ventilator transitions from StandbyMode to active operation the system shall ensure that if PCVModeSelected was active immediately before leaving StandbyMode then the ventilator shall either enter PCVMode or remain in StandbyMode until the previous StandbyMode condition is fully cleared. ID: The system shall always ensure that whenever PCVMode is active; it is either operating in PSVMode with confirmPSVParameters verified; or it is not simultaneously confirming PSV parameters while in PCVMode; and in all such cases the ventilating function shall remain active.

The medical ventilator control software shall ensure that whenever an inspiratoryPause occurs and it was not active immediately before; the system must either have remained continuously without inspiratoryPause before that moment or must not have started expirationPhaseStart while inspiratoryPause was inactive. Furthermore; if after 41 time units such a transition into inspiratoryPause occurs without expirationPhaseStart being active at that same time; then within the previous 40 time units the system must have either not been in a valid operational state or must have initiated expirationPhaseStart while inspiratoryPause was inactive.

ID: If at any point powerOff becomes true and it was previously false then the system shall either be in FinalState or it shall be the very beginning of operation with no prior state history.    In other words for example in an autonomous drone this means that whenever the drone powers off after being powered on it must already have reached its FinalState or it must be the first recorded moment of its operation.
The system shall ensure that whenever PCVMode is active; the value of P_insp is always equal to P_inspPCV at all times during operation.
